Notes: appeared confused and disoriented this morning. Vital signs stable. Reoriented the resident to time place and person. Offered familiar objects or pictures for comfort. Explored the use of a music therapy session to potentially improve mood and cognitive function. Discussed the importance of routine and provided a predictable daily schedule. Monitored cognitive function throughout the day.

seemed hesitant during mealtime. Offered preferred foods cut into smaller pieces and ensured a calm environment. Offered assistance with feeding as needed. Discussed the importance of nutrition and monitored intake throughout the day. Resident expressed appreciation for the assistance. Documented observations and informed nurse.

reported experiencing frequent headaches. Assessed pain level and location. Discussed the use of pain medication as prescribed by doctor and monitored effectiveness. Documented observations and informed nurse about continued headaches.

participated minimally in group activities today. Offered alternative activities like looking at photo albums or light exercises as tolerated. Resident seemed more comfortable participating in gentle hand exercises. Documented observations and informed nurse about headaches.

expressed feeling anxious and restless this morning. Assessed for any triggers and offered calming techniques (e.g. deep breathing exercises). seemed withdrawn today. Offered a familiar comfort item (e.g. favorite blanket) and engaged in gentle conversation about calming topics like nature. Resident seemed to relax slightly. Documented observations and informed nurse about continued anxiety.

appeared less talkative this morning. Vital signs remained stable. Offered emotional support and encouraged expression of feelings. Explored options for occupational therapy to help resident regain some daily living skills (consult doctor for referral).

participated minimally in social activities. Offered opportunities to participate in simple tasks that contribute to the well-being of others (e.g. folding laundry for new residents). reported experiencing occasional nausea. Assessed for any contributing factors and monitored throughout the day (consult doctor if necessary). Discussed dietary modifications that might help alleviate nausea.

seemed withdrawn today. Offered quiet companionship and engaged in reminiscing activities. Resident shared positive memories and seemed more at ease. Documented observations and informed nurse about continued nausea and emotional state.
